bibl.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Copy of Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
COPY OF COMMITMENT.
United States of America Territory of Washington
To any constable and keeper of the County Jail of said County.

Whereas, at a Justice court held here at Slaughter in said County for the trial of I. H. Smith for the offense hereinafter stated, the said I. H. Smith was convicted of having on Sunday evening the 7th. day of Oct. 1888 in the said County committed a theft and feloniously stolen and takon away from the person of Alexander Anderson a silver watch together with $28 in the said County and upon conviction the said court did adjudge and determine that the said I. H. Smith should be imprisoned in the County Jail of the said County for the term of one year wherefore you said the constable are commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convery and deliver the said I. H. Smith to the said keeper and you the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said I. H. Smith into your custody in the said jail, and him there safely keep unti the expiration of the said term of one year or until he shall be discharged by due course of law. Dated this 8th. Oct. 1888.
James Hart Justice of the Peace for Slaughter Precinct of King Co Prisoner gives notice of appeal but can find no bonds he here
